website_summaries.verdict: Engaging card set developed with early childhood educators designed to introduce kids to learning in a lighthearted manner.
pros: Contains 120 colorful, image-driven cards that included either questions or activities
Set receives accolades from the American Academic of Pediatrics for fostering early brain development
cons: Cards could be a bit larger for little hands to handle, and some parents recommended securing them onto a ring

customer_reviews.title: Just what I hoped for
customer_reviews.text: I bought these cards for my 3 1/2 year old grandson and another set for his 4 year old twin cousins. They are just the right level for all 3 kids...some easy, some more challenging which is what I wanted. It enables them to be successful while still learning some new material. Since it is not a "game" with a start and finish, we can grab the cards and spend 5 minutes or half an hour depending on the situation (and attention span at the moment!). I will most certainly buy the higher age levels as they grow.
customer_reviews.author: E. Hewett

customer_reviews.title: Good Learning Tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice learning tool, but I feel it's more geared to children near or older than kindergarten age. That, of course, is dependent on how smart your little ones are. But even if they're not able to read the cards, you can read to them and work with them in that manner. I purchased this for my niece who was 3.5 during Christmas 2017 but opted to not give it to her. I'll wait until next year to give it to her, as it will be more beneficial at that time.
customer_reviews.author: Mike in PA

customer_reviews.title: Not preschool level.
customer_reviews.text: These are not preschool level! They have advanced questions. They need advanced reading and comprehension skills. They don't have consistent categories within same card. They hit on 2 letters throughout series. They hit on 2 colors throughout series. Poorly planned and executed. They really are a disappointment. I will have to hold on to them for years before they can be of use. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: A Fisher-Price Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, fun way to get educate kids.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great way to get your excited about learning. I bought this for my four year old daughter and she loves "playing." It's a game to her...and even if there's a question she doesn't know, it simply presents an opportunity for her to learn something new.
customer_reviews.author: Fool for Christ

customer_reviews.title: Fun cards filled with facts for young kids
customer_reviews.text: My kids love the Melissa & Doug Smarty Pants Cards Set. They like trivia questions and learning about different things. The cards are contain easy and challenges questions for their age set and the questions also make them think and use their imaginations. We bring a set on trips and this definitely makes car rides seem faster. I recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: shopgirl

customer_reviews.title: Using these with our 4 year old for Kindergarten prep
customer_reviews.text: Our son likes these. We make a game of it. Some are a bit simple for him but fun just the same. I was hoping for something I could do with him in the car while I am driving, but this is not it. The cards need to be read to the kids and they need to be able to see the pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Ambervb

customer_reviews.title: This preschool one is for older children.
customer_reviews.text: The preschool version is for a child late in the year in Kindergarten or early First Grade. Most of all, I don't recommend because the print is TOO SMALL on the cards. Instead of so many questions on each card, one on each side would have been better. At least then I could read them!!! OK product, just needs improvements.
customer_reviews.author: K.C.

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this for preschool kids!
customer_reviews.text: My almost 3.5 year old boy likes going through these cards. I feel like most of the content he is able to grasp and whatever he doesn’t understand I either explain it to him or he is able to make another reference out of it. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: gwensin

customer_reviews.title: Good educational product
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 4 year old. She likes the education piece. Not easy to keep all the cards together in the box. Not easy for her to remove the lid to the box herself
customer_reviews.author: Andrew L.

customer_reviews.title: Great table game before dinner.
customer_reviews.text: Wow should have bought these a long time ago. My 4 yest old loves playing with these cards and she learning at the same time. Absolutely love this. Going to buy the kindergarten cards.
customer_reviews.author: Rodezno Family

customer_reviews.title: Labeled incorrectly
customer_reviews.text: The top part says grade 2 and the bottom part says preschool. Very disappointing since I’m not sure i received the correct ones. And the return window has closed.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa G.

customer_reviews.title: Great for preschoolers!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 3 year old. Some is too complex for him, but most is very doable. We can only do a few cards at a time (5 or so) because of short attention spans. But it’s been really fun!
customer_reviews.author: Dutchface

customer_reviews.title: cute
customer_reviews.text: 3 year old does great with it. a nice change from brain quest.
customer_reviews.author: AMP

customer_reviews.title: Confusing
customer_reviews.text: Too confusing for children to use. Wasn't worth the money. Donating to a charity.
customer_reviews.author: Suzin Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Educational
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my great grandchildrebn. Parents say it is similar to wht I kept here for them when they were little.Brought back some fond memories
customer_reviews.author: Theresa M. Contrisciano

customer_reviews.title: Great cards
customer_reviews.text: I really liked these cards and I’m sure I will be using them for a while; so much information is packed on each card. Great learning tool for pre-k and kindergarten kids
customer_reviews.author: Mizmac

customer_reviews.title: Grandkids love it
customer_reviews.text: Grandkids love it. They think of it as a game
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Melissa and Doug fan
customer_reviews.text: Kids love these cards!! Will be buying the different grade options
customer_reviews.author: ABC CUSTOMER

customer_reviews.title: Great educational cards for kids
customer_reviews.text: Our kids love the smarty pants cards, they fight over who gets more cards than the other. Great end of the night calm down cards also!!! We have preschool and kindergarten ones.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Sears

customer_reviews.title: We're having so much fun with these cards
customer_reviews.text: We're having so much fun with these cards. My son is 3 and a half so his attention span is short but he loves to do a few at a time and than quizzes me and his dad.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Nothing like learning fun for the whole family!  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
customer_reviews.text: I take these on our long (10+ hours) road trips to help my 5 year old entertained! The whole family really enjoys reading these and it is fun to hear all the answers that come up! The pants packaging was too big for the car (just put them in a ziplock baggie), but would be perfect way to hold them on a shelf. Nothing like learning fun for the whole family! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
customer_reviews.author: JenGee

customer_reviews.title: Not just a toy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my granddaughter and it is a real winner. It is fun, but challenges her abilities.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine M Rau

customer_reviews.title: My 3.5 yr old loves these cards.
customer_reviews.text: I just wish they were bound together with a ring or something.
customer_reviews.author: ReviewPro2000

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Preschool Trivia Cards! A must-have!
customer_reviews.text: My three year old is obsessed with these Smarty Pants cards! Turns out, she loves trivia and quizzes and every day begs me to do Smarty Pants with her before bed time! This was one of the best and most useful Christmas gifts she received this past Holiday. Well done Melissa & Doug!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Toddler loves it !
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old absolutely loves it. It is age appropriate and there's tons to learn ! A gret activity for parents and children to spend some time together. Recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Preethi Krishnamurthy

customer_reviews.title: Great educational gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 4 1/2 year old and she loves the flash card style learning. Although I kind of wish I have bought the kindergarten age, rather than pre-K to give her more of a challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Hilary

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I actually like These very much. So does my 3 year old
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves these! She asks me to read them to her. We make our way thru the stack with the multiple challenges on each card.
customer_reviews.author: sara g.

customer_reviews.title: Mother & Toddler Approved
customer_reviews.text: my daughter loves her new cards, we practice them daily and she gets a lot of them right, she will be starting preschool in august so were trying to prepare her.
customer_reviews.author: Alaura

customer_reviews.title: They love it.
customer_reviews.text: use it as a game with both my kids. They love it.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi M.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to hold and a nice variety of questions - we enjoy doing these with our 3 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Bianca

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but small size cards.
customer_reviews.text: My kids LOVE these. I was so glad, I thought they would be bored. I do wish they were maybe a bit larger. Its tough for 3 kids to huddle around these small cards to answer the questions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fun learning
customer_reviews.text: Fun to do. My grandson was already beyond this level but his younger brother found it challenging.
customer_reviews.author: Ulla Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My kids love to play these and test their knowledge, they surprised me with how much they knew!
customer_reviews.author: rc

customer_reviews.title: I think the concept is good but the writing and pictures on the cards are ...
customer_reviews.text: I think the concept is good but the writing and pictures on the cards are rather small for a toddler. Some of the puzzles are too advanced for the age group (Pre K).
customer_reviews.author: Ribbons

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 1/2 year old asks for these every night before bed. We do anywhere from 5 - 7 cards and if I would allow, I think she would do them all night long. I highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffani Champion

customer_reviews.title: My 4-nearly 5 year old son has very little attention ...
customer_reviews.text: My 4-nearly 5 year old son has very little attention span...yet he loves these cards! We go through several cards each day with him.
customer_reviews.author: kimberly deyett

customer_reviews.title: Smarty Pants Preschool Card set
customer_reviews.text: This was not exactly what I was looking for as a game for a pre-schooler. I think the cards are too small and difficult for a little one to pick out the matching items.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Woebel

customer_reviews.title: He loved them!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my grandson's 5th birthday. He loved them!!!! They went through them in no time and his mom has already ordered the kindergarten level!
customer_reviews.author: PBR

customer_reviews.title: Overall I love this product
customer_reviews.text: I wish cards were bigger. Overall I love this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fun for an on the go activity. We ditched the container right away though.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Russell

customer_reviews.title: Fun and unique!
customer_reviews.text: These are quite fun for our 3 year old. We play them at meals. They reinforce the skills we work on at home - counting, identification, differentiation, word and picture association.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica K

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson for Christmas, he loves it. I buy Melissa and Doug products whenever I can. Very well made and smart products for kids!
customer_reviews.author: Dianne

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great for getting ready for kindergarden. And it's built a lot of confidence in our daughter.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Good buy!
customer_reviews.text: I have a toddler and this is great to have with her, it teaches her without her realizing she is even learning.
customer_reviews.author: SRBrown

customer_reviews.title: Too easy for a four year old
customer_reviews.text: I bought the pre-k cards for my newly turned 4 year old because he loves stuff like this. However, these cards were way to easy.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Seaman

customer_reviews.title: Love these!  Adorable and such a great learning tool!
customer_reviews.text: Adorable. Can't wait to gift these to our niece today!
customer_reviews.author: M Hirst

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: These are so much fun with the family at the table after dinner!
customer_reviews.author: Momma

customer_reviews.title: dinnertime lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: My 3 yo loved playing this game while I make dinner. The cards will grow with him too, so are a little hard right now, but he still likes to try.
customer_reviews.author: Meags

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun brain teasers for kiddos and some facts even I ...
customer_reviews.text: Lots of fun brain teasers for kiddos and some facts even I didn't know! I would say that PK and K are almost the same level. My 2 and 4.5 year olds like both of them. K isn't necessarily harder than PK, just a different skill set.
customer_reviews.author: CTmom

customer_reviews.title: These are great. A nice at home tool to use to ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great. A nice at home tool to use to prep the little ones for school and to learn fun things. My daughter gets so excited when I get these out. A bonding, fun learning activity!!
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I take it out every day, my 4 yr old loves it
customer_reviews.author: ashwrites

customer_reviews.title: Fun and educational!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very fun and amazing way to teach your little ones about a variety of things. The pictures are very colorful and kid friendly. The kids are drawn towards it and are excited every time they pick it up to find a new question they haven't looked at. They love the name too "Smarty Pants". I got it for my 3.5 yr old and he loves it. Initially his older sister read out the questions for him and she had fun playing teacher as well ☺️ Now, my son just sits by himself going through the questions and confirming g the answers on the back.
customer_reviews.author: piyu

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: My son has really enjoyed these flash cards! I think this will help him be prepared for kindergarten! I will be buying the next level soon.
customer_reviews.author: Crdavis116

customer_reviews.title: Too easy for kids to accidentally knock over.
customer_reviews.text: Good product, good times. but it really needs a stand/base. They are knocked over very easily sending all the cards across the table or worse, to the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Mytwocents

customer_reviews.title: We love it. It's a great game to get them ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter chose to play this game over watching a movie. We love it. It's a great game to get them talking and thinking.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi's Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my niece who turned 5 and she loves it
customer_reviews.author: santy

customer_reviews.title: poss 5 Stars havent opened it yet
customer_reviews.text: I'm only giving 4 stars now bc I bought this as a present and haven't opened it up yet. but the packaging is sturdy and the effect of its look I'm sure will snag my 4 year olds attention to play the "Smarty Pants Game" will add to it once opened.
customer_reviews.author: MsKawiCara

customer_reviews.title: I guess theyre ok.....
customer_reviews.text: I home school. These were too easy for my then three year old. But I kept them...I'm glad I didnt buy all first three levels like I would have if funds had permitted. Why? Because my now 5yr old, 4yr old and almost two yr old? Keep. Opening. Them. So I have to keep. Picking. Them. Up. Because I plan to keep homeschooling....I keep them. For something the oldest can read to the youngest. Yes. They're for my 2 yr old now. Also, I've found BrainQuest. Oooohh yeah. Their products are much better for age appropriateness. And better made. Melissa and Doug? Stick to wood puzzles and toys.....stop trying to corner the whole market. Would NOT buy again. Never.
customer_reviews.author: Made2mom

customer_reviews.title: Text Too Small
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good educational tool. I only gave it 3 stars because the cards are very small and this grandma had difficulty reading the text with my grandson.
customer_reviews.author: Marie McKinlay

customer_reviews.title: Boring
customer_reviews.text: Weird little boring game. Neither me nor my son were impressed. I wouldn't recommend it for children 5 and under.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Cute product
customer_reviews.text: We keep them on the kitchen table more as a talking point for educational topics. My daughter finds them fun
customer_reviews.author: Tami S.

product_meta.title: Melissa & Doug Smarty Pants - Preschool Card Set
product_meta.description:
Smarty Pants Preschool cards let young kids load up on new facts and fun with a deck of educational games and activities just for them! The cards are colorful, creative and packed with illustrated activities, including picture puzzles, math challenges, tongue-twisters, mazes, seek-and-find pictures and much more. Each card set is thoughtfully developed to suit the learning style and curriculum standards of its age range . . . then spiced up with fresh, lively design and an infusion of humor (including a whimsical pants-shaped case!) to keep kids giggling, engaged and excited about learning.

BRAND STORY
By

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
From classic wooden toys to crafts, pretend play, and games, Melissa & Doug products provide a launch pad to ignite imagination and a sense of wonder in all children so they can discover themselves, their passions, and their purpose. 

Since the company’s founding more than 25 years ago, Melissa & Doug has consistently delivered innovative products that inspire open-ended thinking, encourage kids to see new possibilities, and offer Countless Ways to Play. It’s part of a bigger vision to Take Back Childhood. Because by giving children a true childhood with the space and freedom to explore their world, we give them a path to realizing their full potential!

See more
feature_bullets: EDUCATIONAL CARD SET FOR PRESCHOOLERS: The Melissa & Doug Smarty Pants Preschool Card Set includes illustrated activities like picture puzzles, math challenges, tongue-twisters, mazes, vocabulary builders, and more.
DEVELOPED WITH EDUCATORS: Our educational toys have been developed with the input of educators to support the curriculum of each grade level.

WHIMSICAL DESIGN: Melissa & Doug learning games are created with a whimsical design and lighthearted tone to inspire kids to become excited about learning. Each set contains 120 cards, with multiple questions and activities on each of them.

GREAT GIFT FOR AGES 3 to 5: The Preschool Card Set makes a great gift for kids 3 to 5 years. Add the Melissa & Doug Suspend Family Game to round out the hands-on play experience and give kids another engaging option for screen-free fun.

“THE GOLD STANDARD IN CHILDHOOD PLAY”: For more than 30 years, Melissa & Doug has created beautifully designed imagination- and creativity-sparking products that NBC News called “the gold standard in early childhood play.”

100% HAPPINESS GUARANTEE: We design every toy to the highest quality standards, and to nurture minds and hearts. If your child is not inspired, give us a call and we'll make it right. Our phone number is on every product!

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
